abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Yemen Private
            Sector Growth and Social Protection Development Policy Grant
            is to foster private sector growth in the non-hydrocarbon
            part of the economy, to improve key aspects of the public
            financial management system, and to mitigate the impact of
            the ongoing fuel subsidy reduction on the poor by creating a
            more inclusive and more equitable cash transfer system. The
            Project has four components. Component one comprises of
            private sector growth and employment which includes
            streamlining of investment incentives and the simplification
            of business entry procedures. Component two consists of
            enhancing financial intermediation and improving access to
            finance by the effective launch of a credit registry and the
            completion of the framework for micro finance. Component
            three involves public financial management and governance
            which consists of the introduction of a medium term
            expenditure framework (MTEF) and of expenditure Commitment
            Control Systems (CCS) as well as the automation of the
            government financial accounts (AFMIS). Component four
            includes the creation of efficiency and equity of the social
            protection system by the establishment of a targeting method
            to operationalize the Law on Social Welfare of 2008 (Law no.
            39), and by the approval of the by-laws to the Social
            Welfare Law.
